intro: Alchemilla cataractarum, commonly known as the water alchemilla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. It has a shallow root system and is often found in areas with high humidity. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help retain moisture in its preferred habitat.
